attributes.action: Teach about consent and sexual harassment more thoroughly in secondary schools
attributes.additional_details: 97% of woman have been sexually harassed in the UK. These harassment's include unconsented touching, inappropriate sexual comments and wolf whistling to name a few. Woman have to deal with this when at school, work, in bars and walking down the street. This issue needs to be dealt with. I believe that by educating young people on the the harm this can have and the repercussions they can face, it will help to reduce the high percentage of victims.
attributes.background: Woman all over the world are still being treated unfairly and fear for their safety on a daily basis. If schools taught the impact of sexual harassment it would help educate young people before they acted out these behaviours.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the current petition we have open on this topic:
